Stories We're Featured In Contact PR 080-46682650 / 607 pr@signdesk.com Stories We're Featured In Digital Stamping To mark the release of a new and improved version of SignDesk's digital stamping solution, Business Standard, a leading business newspaper, published an article heralding digital stamping and SignDesk's role in the stamping out of fraud in India. Financial Crime in a Digital Age — Why Banks Need a Holistic Approach SignDesk's Co-Founder spoke to Biometric update about Banks can no longer adequately deal with threats of cybercrime on a case-by-case basis, due to the sheer volume of threats and explained about how SignDesk helps control financial fraud. Digital Signatures in COVID-19 Krupesh Bhat, SignDesk's founder, spoke to Money Control about how SignDesk is helping businesses sign & execute contracts digitally, and how an increasing number of businesses are looking for a digital contracting product. End-to-end Loan Digitization SignDesk's co-founder Ashok Kadsur spoke to iBS intelligence about how SignDesk's products enabled digitized loans which helped banks and NBFCs support businesses through the COVID-19 pandemic. Priority Lending for Start-ups With RBI including start-ups in the priority sector lending group, SignDesk's co-founder Ashok Kadsur spoke to Business Standard about how young start-ups with fresh ideas need better financial backing. Increased Demand for Digitization SignDesk's founder Krupesh Bhat spoke to The Week about how IT companies are seeing a rising interest in their digitized solutions in the wake of COVID-19 and how SignDesk is responding to this growing demand. Innovation in RegTech SignDesk was featured in the Economic Times in an article about how legal tech startups such as SignDesk are revolutionising RegTech with innovative use of technology. Financial Crime in a Digital Age — Why Banks Need a Holistic Approach Digital Signatures in COVID-19 Priority Lending for Start-ups Increased Demand for Digitization Sector-wide Automation Krupesh Bhat, SignDesk's founder, spoke to the Hindu about how businesses in healthcare, FMCG, education, and cosmetics are digitizing their workflows with SignDesk's solutions. Chinese Cyber-attacks on Indian Institutions In the wake of numerous cyber-attacks, SignDesk's co-founder Ashok Kadsur spoke to the Economic Times about how the Chinese are targeting India's IT and banking sector. Safeguarding from Hackers SignDesk's founder Krupesh Bhat spoke to Times Now about the steps that businesses and the common man can take to protect themselves against cyber-attacks. Cryptocurrency Boom The Week spoke to SignDesk's co-founder Ashok Kadsur about the lockdown-fuelled boom in cryptocurrency trading and how it might pan out given the looming ban on crypto trading. How AI & ML Enables Process Automation in Digital Onboarding By combining the pattern detection & decision-making capabilities of well-trained AI, businesses can apply AI & ML models to detect fraud, improve customer experience & boost process automation. Improving Accessibility in Contactless Banking Using Video KYC Krupesh Bhat, Founder of SignDesk - speaks about Contactless Banking and the SignDesk part in paperless banking documentation. Blockchain based KYC - The Future of Verification Insights from market-oriented research has shown that DLTs such as blockchain can help with the elimination of inefficiencies and duplication in KYC processes. Chinese Cyber-attacks on Indian Institutions How AI & ML Enables Process Automation in Digital Onboarding Improving Accessibility in Contactless Banking Using Video KYC Blockchain based KYC - The Future of Verification The Future of Onboarding SignDesk's co-founder Ashok Kadsur spoke to Money control about how SignDesk uses AI & ML to expedite and automate onboarding to make it faster and safer. Govt. Should Create Public, Digital Infrastructure: Nandan Nilekani SignDesk featured in Business Standard on its launch on August 3, 2016. Launched by former UIDAI Chief, Mr. Nandan Nilekani, explained how the government creates a legal infrastructure and private bodies build on it with innovative solutions for more efficient use. Aadhaar-linked Digital Signature Facility Launched The leading Indian daily newspaper covered SignDesk's Aadhaar based eSign service on its online platform a day after its launch. Make Legal Documentation Quick and Simple Two days before the SignDesk website launch, Deccan Herald published an article about LegalDesk.com making legal documentation procedures easy. Similarly, SignDesk is a faster way of signing documents online within minutes from anywhere, at any time. Now, Get Legal and Professional Help in a Click The Economic Times reported on SignDesk's quick and efficient system for drafting legal documents online and instantly eSigning documents. The Legal Stamp! Entrepreneur India magazine announced the company as a hassle-free legal documentation service provider in India. SignDesk Rolls Out Digitised E-Stamping Solution Across India Krupesh Bhat, the founder of SignDesk - Stamping is so ubiquitous in activities such as taking loans, and executing contracts that people take for granted how inconvenient the physical stamping process is. I'm glad to say that digital stamping has actually helped people in this respect. Video-based Customer Identification Procedure or V-CIP is a seamless, real-time, and end-to-end encrypted procedure envisaged by RBI for digital customer identification and paperless KYC verification. This alternative video-based process is carried out by banks or other Regulated Entities (REs) through an official trained for face-to-face V-CIP. The process involves Online or offline Aadhaar verification for banks & other REs PAN image & live photo capture Image data validation & facial matching Geo-tagging to determine customer location Fully automated customer onboarding & video KYC verification Experience the AI-powered frontier of Online Video KYC verification Cost-effective KYC verification at incredible speeds Utilizes cutting-edge OCR, data extraction & verification techniques to deliver a customer onboarding product that steps hard on the gas but is light on your wallet Cutting-edge AI Employs state-of-the-art ML techniques and smart AI to instantly spot fake IDs, predict your compliance requirements, and verify KYC documents Geared to impress with VCIP Boasts an attractive and intuitive UI that ensures your customers sail smoothly through the VCIP-enabled onboarding process with zero drop-offs Industry-grade security Robust liveness checks and anti-fraud filters deter any potential scammers and enterprise-level client data security protects your customers' information End-to-end solution Zero add ons, no third parties, and no fat. A lightweight and self-contained onboarding solution that fits Video KYC into your digital channels Assured compliance Automated compliance and risk management technology ensures compliance, our smart notification and workflow management system leaves a virtual paper trail so you never miss anything Paper-free KYC Physical KYC verification is a drain on your efficiency and results in excessive costs. Our completely digital Video KYC verification solution utilizes VCIP to clear away the paper and pave the way for you to reach the top. Are you ready to cut your KYC costs by up to 90% using Video KYC? Highlights of SignDesk's Video KYC Solution Banks & other financial institutions spend weeks to onboard a single customer and shell out millions for KYC checks and compliance requirements. SignDesk's digital customer onboarding solution cuts onboarding costs by 90% and uses VCIP to provide a single, compliant, and fraud-free platform that takes your customers through the Video KYC process smoothly. All your customers need to take out a loan or open an account is a phone with an internet connection. Insurance companies need to verify several documents, confirm identities, and complete long KYC procedures to onboard customers. This results in long waiting times and several customers leaving the onboarding process unfinished. SignDesk provides your customers with an intuitive and friendly onboarding experience by leveraging the latest in ML techniques and secure e-signatures with an acute legal understanding, so your insurance company can onboard customers quickly using Video KYC and meet all their needs. Securities & mutual funds Regulated intermediaries take an inordinate amount of time to onboard and verify investors. This process is further complicated by document verification and KYC checks. SignDesk offers an efficient and cost-effective way for intermediaries to onboard investors using SEBI-compliant video-based verification. Our Video KYC solution is quick, lightweight, and ensures onboarding with zero drop-offs. Both companies and HR consultancies require an expedient and attractive employee-centric onboarding solution to give new employees a welcoming first experience. Our customizable employee onboarding product ensures that your company makes the perfect first impression on new employees using VCIP, priming them for a long and productive relationship with your company. Welcome to SignDesk's (referred to as "Policyâ€). SignDesk.com is owned by Desk Nine Private Limited. SignDesk.com, Desk Nine Private Limited, its affiliates, sister companies, and subsidiaries (collectively, "SignDeskâ€, "weâ€, "our†or "usâ€) are engaged inter alia in the business of providing AI based digital documentation solutions, more fully described in our of Use , and any other policies we may make available on the Platform from time to time (collectively, " â€). This Policy outlines our practices in relation to the collection, storage, usage, processing, and disclosure of personal data that you have chosen to share with us when you access, use, or otherwise interact with our website available at www.signdesk.com or our mobile application (collectively, "Platformâ€), avail products or services that SignDesk offers you on or though the Platform, or partner with us to provide customers with these services (collectively, the "Servicesâ€). At SignDesk, we are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data. In order to provide you with access to the Services, we have to collect and otherwise process certain data about you. This Policy explains how we process and use personal data about you. By interacting with us, submitting information to us, and using the Services, you confirm that you have read and agree to be bound by this Policy and consent to the collection, use, disclosure, and/or retention of your personal information in accordance with the processing activities described under this Policy. In certain circumstances you may provide us with the personal data of other individuals such as your business partners, customers, clients, users, or vendors. You represent and warrant that you have obtained such individuals' informed consent for their personal data to be collected, used, or disclosed in accordance with this Policy. Your information will be used in other ways for which specific notice may be provided at the time of collection. This supplements but does not supersede nor replace any other consent which you may have previously provided to us, nor does it affect any right that we may have at law in connection with the collection, use, disclosure and/or retention of your personal data. Please refer to Section 1 to understand how the of this Policy apply to you. 1. BACKGROUND AND KEY INFORMATION About Us: The Services are made available to you by SignDesk. If you have any questions about this Policy, how we process or handle your personal data, or otherwise, you may reach out to us with your queries, grievances, feedback, and comments by contacting our grievance officer/data protection officer whose details are provided below. Name: Sudhanva Siddhant Holla Designation: Grievance Officer/ Data Protection Officer Email: privacy@signdesk.com How this Policy applies: This Policy applies to all natural and legal persons' and individuals who are competent to contract and who access or use our website, mobile applications, or other products or services made available by us or prospective customers of our products and services (hereafter, "Usersâ€) and our clients who use the Platform to provide the Services to their Users ("Clientsâ€). For the avoidance of doubt, references to "you†across this Policy are to Users and Clients. By using the Services, you consent to the collection, storage, usage, and disclosure of your personal data, as described in, and collected by us in accordance with this Policy. Data Controller: SignDesk is a controller for any information directly received through your use of the Platform. SignDesk is committed to process such data fairly and reasonably and in a manner that protects the interest of the Users. We solely determine the manner in which your personal data is processed. Data Processor: In case you use the Platform through our Clients, SignDesk is a processor and your data shall be controlled through in the manner provided in their . Any data collected from you is solely limited to your use of the Platform. Our Clients shall be the data controller in this regard. Third-Party Links: The Platform may include links to third-party websites, plug-ins, applications, and services. Clicking on those links or enabling those connections may allow third parties to collect or share data about you. We do not control these third-party websites and are not responsible for such sites' content, any use of such sites, or their privacy statements or the security of any data shared with such third-party websites. Once you have left our website, we cannot be responsible for the protection and privacy of any personal data which you provide. When you leave the Platform or otherwise access such websites, plug-ins, applications, and services, we encourage you to read the made available by the third-party. 2. PERSONAL DATA THAT WE COLLECT When you use the Services as a User, we collect different types of personal data about you. This includes but is not limited to: Contact Data, such as your email address, location, pin code and phone numbers. Identity and Profile Data, such as your name, government issued identifier (Aadhaar and PAN details), passport, or other identification number, telephone numbers, username or similar identifiers, age, photographs, gender, and type of business, business information. Marketing and Communications Data, such as your email address, information posted in service requests, offers, wants, feedback, comments, and discussions in our blog and chat boxes, your preferences in receiving marketing communications from us and our third parties, and your communication preferences. Technical Data, which includes your IP address, browser type, internet service provider, details of operating system, registered domain or home server, access time, page views, device ID, device type, frequency of visiting our website and use of the Platform, website and mobile application activity, clicks, date, API Logs, and time stamps, location data, search , search results, access times, and referring website's address(es), and other technology on the devices that you use to access the Platform. Transaction Data, such as details of the Services you have availed, your credit or debit card details for tracking transactions that you may provide us through our payment processors, including banking details and UPI IDs for processing payments, as applicable. Usage Data, which includes information about how you use the Services, your activity on the Platform, user taps and clicks, user interests, time spent on the Platform, details About User journey on the mobile application, and page views. When you use the Services as a Client, we collect different types of personal data about you. This includes but is not limited to: Contact Data, such as email addresses, phone numbers, location, pincode, permanent address, and registered offices. Identity and Profile-related Data, such as your name, your authorized representative's name and details, mobile number, gender, date of birth, age, address, zip code, description of services provided, content and information about your business including photographs and videos, credit or debit card details, government-issued identifiers (Aadhaar details, PAN details), cancelled cheque, GST details, tax residency certificate, information from testimonials, polls, surveys, and feedbacks. Technical Data, which includes your IP address, browser type, internet service provider, details of operating system, registered domain or home server, access time, page views, device ID, device type, frequency of visiting our website and use of the Platform, website and mobile application activity, clicks, date, API Logs, and time stamps, location data, search , search results, access times, and referring website's address(es), device metadata, and other technology on the devices that you use to access the Platform. Marketing and Communications Data, such as feedback, comments, and discussions in our blog, responses, your preferences in receiving marketing communications from us and our third parties, and your communication preferences. Transaction Data, such as details of the Services you have availed, your credit or debit card details for tracking transactions that you may provide us through our payment processors, including banking details and UPI IDs for processing payments, as applicable. Usage Data, which includes information about how you use the Services, your activity on the Platform, user taps and clicks, user interests, time spent on the Platform, details About User journey on the mobile application, and page views. We also collect, use, and share aggregated data such as statistical or demographic data for any purpose. Aggregated data could be derived from your personal data but is not considered personal data under law as it does not directly or indirectly reveal your identity. However, if we combine or connect aggregated data with your personal data so that it can directly or indirectly identify you, we treat the combined data as personal data which will be used in accordance with this Policy. What happens if I refuse to provide my personal data? Where we need to collect personal data by law, or under the of a contract (such as the ), and you fail to provide that data when requested, we may not be able to perform the contract (for example, to provide you with the Services). In this case, we may have to cancel or limit your access to the Services, but we will, where reasonably practical, notify you if this is the case at the time. The Platform is not intended or designed to attract or be otherwise used by children under the age of 18 years. It is not intended to collect personal information from or about children under the age of 18 years. Children under the age of 18 years should not submit their personal data via the Platform. If you believe that your child has submitted personal information and you would like to request that their information be removed from our systems, please submit a request to the Grievance Officer/ Data Protection Officer in the manner described in Section 1(a) to this Policy and reasonable efforts will be made to comply with your request within 30 (Thirty) days of the request. 3.HOW DO WE COLLECT PERSONAL DATA? We use different methods to collect personal data from and about you including through: Direct Interactions. You provide us your personal data when you interact with us. This includes personal data you provide when you, for example: create an account or profile with us at the time of registration; use the Platform or the Services; request marketing communications to be sent to you; or report a problem with the Platform and/or our Services, give us feedback, contact us, or provide testimonials. create an account or profile with us at the time of registration on the Platform, or through third party social media platforms (including but not limited to Facebook, Google, or Gmail); submit an enquiry or a quote request with us; use the Platform or the Services; request that we contact you and/or interact with our customer servicing team via our communication channels such as a phone call; facilitate payments through the Platform; complete purchase orders, requests or applications for our products or services (by phone, in person, snail mail, or electronically); interact with our promotional advertisements or social media posts, whether inadvertently or otherwise through any third party platforms; report a problem with the Platform and/or our Services, give us feedback, contact us, or provide testimonials; perform an online transaction; respond to our request for additional personal data; or submit your personal data to us for any other reason; provide us with camera permissions that allows you to upload any picture straight from the camera; or provide us with access to your photo gallery that allows you to upload any picture from your photo gallery. We also collect information from mobile devices for a better user experience like: Camera (Pictures): Granting camera permission allows the user to upload any picture straight from the camera, you can safely deny camera permissions for this. Photo Gallery (Pictures): Granting photo gallery access allows the user to upload any picture from their photo gallery, you can safely deny photo gallery access for this. Automated technologies or interactions. We automatically collect Technical Data about your operating system, equipment, browsing actions, and patterns each time you use the Platform. We collect this personal data by using cookies, web beacons, pixel tags, server logs, and other similar technologies. We may also receive Technical Data about you if you visit other websites that employ our cookies. We may also collect information about your usage and browsing habits using various web-based technologies. Third parties or publicly available sources. We will receive personal data about you from various third parties, including, without limitation: Technical Data from analytics providers such as Google Analytics, Google and advertising networks; Our business partners or our Clients through which you create or access the Platform, such as payment providers, social media services, or applications or websites who use our APIs or whose API we use; Background verifiers; Credit reference bodies, regulatory and law enforcement authorities, for reasons including delivery of our products and/or services, performance of conditions of agreements and/or to comply with our legal and regulatory obligations; Identity and profile-related data from publicly available sources; and Marketing service providers. 4. HOW DO WE USE YOUR PERSONAL DATA? We will only use your personal data when the law allows us to do so. Most commonly, we will use your personal data where we need to provide the Services, or where we need to comply with a legal obligation. We use your personal data for the following purposes: to communicate with you; to maintain and improve customer relationship; to administer and process any payments related to products, services and/or facilities requested by you; to establish your identity and background; to verify your identity, and create your user account with us on the Platform at the time of registration and to manage your account, including access to your purchase history; to provide the Services to you including processing your order and providing you with end-to-end interior design and execution services;, and to administer or otherwise carry out obligations to you; if you are a Client, to assess the performance of your services rendered to Users; The right to restrict processing – You have the right to request SignDesk to restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions. The right to object to processing – You have the right to object to SignDesk's processing of your personal data, under certain conditions. The right to data portability – You have the right to request SignDesk to transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions. The right to object to automated decision making – You have the right to request SignDesk to not be a subject to automated decision making in a way that adversely affects your legal rights, under certain conditions. TRANSFERS OF YOUR PERSONAL DATA We comply with applicable laws in respect of storage and transfers of personal data, and ensure that the recipient of your personal data ensures a level of data protection comparable to the standards under applicable laws. As a part of your use of the Services, the information and personal data you provide to us may be transferred to and stored in countries other than the country you are based in, in accordance with the procedure prescribed under applicable laws. This may happen if any of our servers are from time to time located in a country other than the one you are based, or one of our service providers is located in a country other than one you are based in. By submitting your information and personal data to us, you agree to the transfer, storage, and processing of such information and personal data in the manner described above. We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal data from unauthorised access, and follow standards prescribed by applicable law. We implement physical, electronic, and managerial privacy protective features such as encryption, password protection and role-based access control. We have implemented various strategies, controls, policies, and measures to keep your data secure and keep these measures under close review. We do our best to ensure that your data is protected and only accessible to SignDesk Group employees (or subcontractors) who need it to carry out their job responsibilities. We are committed to providing appropriate security controls to protect your personal information. However, no security system is perfect, and it cannot be promised that information about you will remain secure in all circumstances, including the security of your data during transmission or the security of data on your device. There is always a risk that a third party, without authorisation, might unlawfully access the systems or otherwise access personal information. We are also not responsible for the authenticity of any information which is provided by you or otherwise collected from your use of the Services, whether personal or otherwise. It is important that you also play a role in keeping your personal data safe and secure. When signing up for an online account, please be sure to choose an account password that would be difficult for others to guess and never reveal your password to anyone else. You are responsible for keeping this password confidential and for any use of your account. If you use a shared or public computer, never choose to have your login ID/email address or password remembered and make sure to of your account every time you leave the computer. You should also make use of any privacy settings or controls we provide you in our Platform. Please further note that identity theft and the practice known as "phishing" are of great concern to us. Safeguarding information to help protect you from identity theft is a top priority. We do not and will not, at any time, request your credit card information or national identification numbers in a non-secure or unsolicited e-mail or telephone communication. You agree and acknowledge that your personal data will continue to be stored and retained by us for as long as necessary to fulfil our stated purpose(s) and for a reasonable period after the termination of your account on the Platform or access to the Services to comply with our legal rights and obligations. In some circumstances, we may aggregate your personal data (so that it can no longer be associated with you) for research or statistical purposes, in which case we may use this information indefinitely without further notice to you. The right to restrict processing – You have the right to request SignDesk to restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions. The right to object to processing – You have the right to object to SignDesk's processing of your personal data, under certain conditions. The right to data portability – You have the right to request SignDesk to transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.
